question_title: Before March 1, 2026, will Meta settle the lawsuit brought by state attorneys general alleging the platform(s) were designed to foster compulsive use by minors?
summary: The question asks whether Meta will settle the state AG coalition lawsuit (People of California v. Meta Platforms, 4:23-cv-05448) before March 1, 2026 — only ~21 days from today. The evidence overwhelmingly points to No. The case is deep in active litigation: discovery disputes were ongoing through late 2025, a stipulation about pre-motion letter briefs was filed in September 2025, states sought to combine their claims into a single trial as recently as December 2025, and federal bellwether trials aren't expected until summer/late 2026. Meta has shown no willingness to settle — it proceeded to trial in the LA bellwether case (Jan 2026) and is fighting the NM AG trial (Feb 2026) while TikTok and Snap settled. Legal sources explicitly state "no Facebook or Meta lawsuit mental health settlements have been announced yet" as of February 2026. A comprehensive settlement with 30+ states on complex issues of platform design and youth addiction cannot realistically be negotiated, agreed upon, and formally documented in 21 days when there are no signs of settlement talks having even begun. The community prediction of 29% appears significantly too high, likely reflecting the novelty of the question.

factors.description: No reports of settlement negotiations between Meta and the AG coalition — no news, no filings, no leaks suggesting talks are underway
Only ~21 days remain — comprehensive multistate settlements (30+ states) require months of negotiation and formal documentation
Meta's litigation posture is aggressive — proceeding to trial in bellwether cases (LA, NM) rather than settling, filing motions to dismiss, fighting discovery
Federal bellwether trials not scheduled until summer/late 2026, indicating no urgency in the federal MDL timeline
TikTok and Snap settlements in related cases could create pressure on Meta to eventually settle, but this is a long-term factor not relevant to 21-day window
Legal source from Feb 2026 explicitly states no Meta mental health settlements have been announced
